sect2.title: RequestResponseJmsSender
sect2.para: The RequestResponseJmsSender is supposed to be used in request-response scenarios. First it sends a JMS message to the target destination (specified by the target property) and then waits to receive the response message from the response destination (specified by the responseTarget property).

It is based on JmsSender (see
) so it inherits its properties.

row.entry: A JMS destination where the sender will wait and receive a response message from.
A time duration in ms of specifying how long the sender will wait to receive the response message.
A Number of attempts to receive the message.

simplesect.title: An example of RequestResponseJmsSender configuration
simplesect.programlisting: ... <sender class="RequestResponseJmsSender"> <property name="target" value="jms/queue/RequestQueue"/> <property name="responseTarget" value="jms/queue/ResponseQueue"/> <property name="receivingTimeout" value="30000"/> <property name="receiveAttempts" value="1"/> <property name="connectionFactory" value="jms/ConnFactory"/> <property name="username" value="KingRoland"/> <property name="password" value="12345"/> <!-- JNDI properties--> <property name="jndiContextFactory" value="pkg.InitCtxFactory"/> <property name="jndiUrl" value="remote://${server.host}:4447"/> <property name="jndiSecurityPrincipal" value="KingRoland"/> <property name="jndiSecurityCredentials" value="12345"/> ... </sender> ...
